author: Nicholas Bariyo
title: Hunger Woes Escalate in War-Torn South Sudan
text:
At least two-thirds of the residents of oil-rich South Sudan are at risk of extreme hunger as the country tries to contain a devastating four-year conflict, aid agencies and the government said.

Some 5.3 million people, almost half of the population, struggled to find enough food in January, as aid agencies brace to help a record number of people in need this year, a report released by the United Nations and South Sudanese government on Monday said. Two-thirds of the population will need food aid this year, the report added,...
